result.execSummary:
The defendant Melvin D. Gasper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to Jail (Felony), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1r)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment.

All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment.

Defendant is granted credit for time served in the amount of 6 days as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department.
Granted Good time 
Defendant is allowed to serve jail time in any county as long as the defendant makes the arrangments and it costs Ashland County nothing. 
Contact ACJ in 7 days to set up jail start date.
The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days.

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

02:20 PM Defendant Melvin D. Gasper in court, in custody in ACJ.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Melvin D. Gasper appeared by video means.   COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. Def was picked up on warrant that has been out for while. Has not contacted PD office. 15CF52 was never addressed. 14CF25 def was convicted but never sentenced. 72692 North Co Rd E, Hayward Wi. Retired. State comments on bail/bond. WARRANTS CANCELLED. State is asking for a cash bail in 15CF52- Ct questions the def, still on Probation. Def will contact PD office. 
Ct orders on 15CF52-- $500 cash  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 21, 2021 at 08:15 am.
